Pressure¶

Français¶

Description:

  • Calcul du champ de pression pour une coordonnée verticale donnée.

  • La définition des différentes coordonnées est disponible dans ce document.

  • Possibilité de calculer la pression dans le cas d’une atmosphère normalisée (pression constante).

  • D’autres types de coordonnées verticales pourront être ajoutées et documentées dans le futur.

*Méthode d’itération:*

  • niveau par niveau

*Dépendances:*

  • Un champ quelconque sur un ensemble de niveaux verticaux donnés

*Résultat(s):*

  • Champ de pression PX (hPa, ou mb), sur l’ensemble des niveaux donnés

*Algorithme:*

  • https://wiki.cmc.ec.gc.ca/images/5/5c/Spooki_-_Algorithme_du_plugin_Pressure.pdf

*Références:*

  • Inspiré de l’utilitaire r.hy2pres de la librairie RMNLIB de RPN

*Mots clés:*

  • MÉTÉO/WEATHER, pression/pressure, niveau/level, coordonnée/coordinate, r.hy2pres

*Usage:*

Exemple d’appel:

...
spooki_run "[ReaderStd --input $SPOOKI_DIR/pluginsRelatedStuff/Pressure/testsFiles/inputFile.std] >>
            [Pressure --coordinateType ETA_COORDINATE --referenceField TT] >>
            [WriterStd --output /tmp/$USER/outputFile.std]"
...

Validation des résultats:

Contacts:

  • Auteur(e) : Sandrine Edouard

  • Codé par : Sébastien Fortier

  • Support : CMDW / CMDS

*Ce plugin utilise:*
Ce plugin est utilisé par:
Voir la référence à

Tests Unitaires

English¶

Description:

  • Calculation of the pressure field for a given vertical coordinate.

  • The definition of the different coordinates are available in this document.

  • Possibility to calculate the pressure in the case of a standard atmosphere (constant pression ).

  • Others types of vertical coordinates could be added and documented in the future.

*Iteration method:*

  • level by level

*Dependencies:*

  • Any field on a set of given vertical levels

*Result(s):*

  • Pressure field PX (hPa or mb), on all the given levels

*Algorithm:*

  • https://wiki.cmc.ec.gc.ca/images/5/5c/Spooki_-_Algorithme_du_plugin_Pressure.pdf

*Reference:*

  • Inspired from the r.hy2pres utility of the RMNLIB library of RPN

*Keywords:*

  • MÉTÉO/WEATHER, pression/pressure, niveau/level, coordonnée/coordinate, r.hy2pres

*Usage:*

Call example:

...
spooki_run "[ReaderStd --input $SPOOKI_DIR/pluginsRelatedStuff/Pressure/testsFiles/inputFile.std] >>
            [Pressure --coordinateType ETA_COORDINATE --referenceField TT] >>
            [WriterStd --output /tmp/$USER/outputFile.std]"
...

Results validation:

Contacts:

  • Author : Sandrine Edouard

  • Coded by : Sébastien Fortier

  • Support : CMDW / CMDS

Reference to .

Unit tests

Uses:
Used by:

Python Module¶

class spookipy.pressure.pressure.Eta2Pressure(levels, pt_data, bb_data, p0_data, standard_atmosphere=False)¶

Encompasses information and algorithms to compute pressure for SIGMA vertical coordinate type

Parameters

  • levels (list) – list of levels to create the vgrid descriptor

  • pt_data (np.ndarray) – top pressure array (at least 1 value), if None bb_data must be supplied

  • bb_data (np.ndarray) – vertical coordinate descriptor table, if None pt_data must be supplied

  • p0_data (np.ndarray) – surface pressure array

  • standard_atmosphere (bool, optional) – use standard atmosphere algorithm, defaults to False

eta_to_pres(level)¶

eta to pressure conversion function

Parameters

level (float) – current level

Returns

pressure array for current level

Return type

np.ndarray

class spookipy.pressure.pressure.Hybrid2Pressure(hy_data, hy_ig1, hy_ig2, p0_data, levels, standard_atmosphere=False)¶

Encompasses information and algorithms to compute pressure for HYBRID vertical coordinate type

Parameters

  • levels (list) – list of levels to create the vgrid descriptor

  • hy_data (np.ndarray) – GEM hybrid vertical coordinate descriptor array

  • hy_ig1 (float) – reference pressure

  • hy_ig2 (float) – r coefficient

  • bb_data (np.ndarray) – vertical coordinate descriptor table

  • p0_data (np.ndarray) – surface pressure array

  • standard_atmosphere (bool, optional) – use standard atmosphere algorithm, defaults to False

get_ptop_pref_rcoef()¶

get ptop, pref and rcoef values from hy pds

Parameters

  • hy_df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe of hy

  • levels (np.ndarray) – level array

Returns

presure at top, reference pressure, reference coefficient

Return type

tuple

hybrid to pressure conversion function

Parameters

level (float) – current level

Returns

pressure array for current level

Return type

np.ndarray

class spookipy.pressure.pressure.HybridStaggered2Pressure(bb_data, p0_data, standard_atmosphere=False)¶

Encompasses information and algorithms to compute pressure for HYBRID_STAGGERED vertical coordinate type

Parameters

  • bb_data (np.ndarray) – vertical coordinate descriptor table

  • p0_data (np.ndarray) – surface pressure array

  • standard_atmosphere (bool, optional) – use standard atmosphere algorithm, defaults to False

get_std_atm_pressure(a, b, pref)¶

hybrid staggered to pressure conversion function Formule utilisee: Px en Pa = exp( a + b * ln(p0*100.0/ pref)). On doit diviser le resultat par 100 pour le ramener en hPa. :param a : :type a : float :param b : :type b : float :param p0 : en hPa :type p0: float :param pref : en Pa :type pref: float :return pressure for current level :rtype: float

class spookipy.pressure.pressure.Pressure(df, reference_field=None, standard_atmosphere=False)¶

creates a pressure field associated to a level for each identified vertical coordinate type

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – input dataframe

  • reference_field (str, optional) – field to use to get levels, defaults to None

  • standard_atmosphere (bool, optional) – calculate pressure in standard atmosphere if specified, defaults to False

compute()¶

groups records by grid->vctype->forecast_hour then applies the appropriate algorithm to compute the pressure

Returns

a dataframe containing available pressure

Return type

pd.DataFrame

validate_input()¶

Checks that the plugin’s dataframe is not empty.

Raises

EmptyDataframeError – The plugin’s dataframe is empty, no data to process.

spookipy.pressure.pressure.compute_pressure_from_eta_coord_array(levels, pt_data, bb_data, p0_data, standard_atmosphere=False)¶

compute pressure array for a ETA vertical coordinate type

Parameters

  • levels (list) – list of pressure levels in ETA coord

  • pt_data (np.ndarray) – top pressure array (at least 1 value), if None bb_data must be supplied

  • bb_data (np.ndarray) – vertical coordinate descriptor table, if None pt_data must be supplied

  • p0_data (np.ndarray) – surface pressure array

  • standard_atmosphere (bool, optional) – use standard atmosphere algorithm, defaults to False

Returns

list of dictionnaries {level:np.ndarray}

Return type

list

spookipy.pressure.pressure.compute_pressure_from_eta_coord_df(df, meta_df, standard_atmosphere=False)¶
Compute the pressure matrix for a dataframe containing one vertical coordinate type (vctype) of type ETA

and only one forecast hour

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – contains variables of the same vctype (ETA)

  • df – contains all accompanying metadata (P0, PT or !!)

  • standard_atmosphere (bool) – calculate pressure in standard atmosphere if specified, defaults to False

Returns

dataframe containing PX records for all found levels in the input dataframe

Return type

pd.DataFrame
